definition: the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory

sentences.english: The profession and the public do not appreciate that advertising claims come without proof in the case of diets.
sentences.chinese: 医生同业和大众没有察知广告所宣称的饮食并无论证。

sentences.english: Tailor your presentations; don't be generic.
sentences.chinese: 量身订做你的自我陈述，不要大众化。

sentences.english: This gave the impression that the police were content simply to look on.
sentences.chinese: 这给了大众一种印象，警方仅仅满足于作壁上观。

sentences.english: Stanely:I just moved and there is no public transportation available.
sentences.chinese: 我刚搬家，附近没有大众交通工具可搭。

sentences.english: The con man has used my name card to cheat people and customers.
sentences.chinese: 这个骗徒拿我的名片欺骗大众和消费者。

sentences.english: Zhang Xingbin lawyers said that the public very little understanding of the policy.
sentences.chinese: 张兴彬律师表示，了解该项政策的大众很少。

sentences.english: The popular sports in the country include football and water polo.
sentences.chinese: 国内的大众体育项目有足球和水球。

sentences.english: And how did we get the new icon of mass consumerism in his place?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何从他的身上找到大众消费主义的新偶像？

sentences.english: The bus for the railroad station, I think it's no. 36.
sentences.chinese: 乘开往火车站的大众汽车，我想是36路吧。

sentences.english: Mosley was known by casual fight fans years before Floyd was.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯利被大众拳迷所熟悉的时间要早于梅威瑟。

sentences.english: There were a lot of beat-up VW vans around.
sentences.chinese: 周围有很多破旧的大众牌汽车。

sentences.english: The value orientation and objective effect of Liang Qichao's thought in popularization.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超大众化文学思想的价值取向与客观效果。

sentences.english: It's not a food of mass consumption, like noodles or rice.
sentences.chinese: 这可不像面条或大米一样，是大众能消费的食物。

sentences.english: It wants to be the number one carmaker by 2018.
sentences.chinese: 大众也希望自己能在2018年成为汽车产业的一哥。

sentences.english: Thailand will provide training for mass media on gender issues.
sentences.chinese: 泰国将为大众传播媒体提供性别问题培训。

sentences.english: I happened to see a Shanghai Dazhong service station over here.
sentences.chinese: 我看这边正好有上海大众的维修站。

definition: proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
Toyota or Toyoda (name)/Toyota, Japanese car make
minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
Škoda, Czech Republic car manufacturer, a subsidiary of Volkswagen Group
main stream (of a river)/fig. the essential point/main viewpoint of a matter/mainstream (culture etc)
